Hi Alejandro,
   I think Cantera or the python interpreter of cti files may=
 read/write
files to a windows system directory. This causes problems when =
the user
doesn't have admin privileges. I'll post this as a possible bug/fe=
ature
request on Cantera's sourceforge.net website. Fixes/solutions for thi=
s
probably require some testing to ensure that changing the location of
tem=
porary files work in all cases.
 
Best wishes,
Harry
 

Harry Moffat       =
                                      (w) (505)
844-6912 
Multiphase Transp=
ort Processes Division    (f)   (505) 844-9297 
Sandia National Laboratorie=
s
hkmoffa@... 
P. O. Box 5800-0834 
Albuquerque, NM 87185-0834 

 

=
________________________________

From: cantera@yahoogroups.com [mailto:can=
tera@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of Alejandro Molina Ochoa
Sent: Monday, Sep=
tember 18, 2006 7:37 PM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] Cant=
era as an User in WINDOWS XP



Hi,

 

I just installed Cantera (Cantera16=
0r1.msi) with the different python
and numpy components in a Windows XP mac=
hine.  Everything works great if
I have administrator privileges.  But when=
 I log as an user I cannot run
Cantera.  I can run python though.  Any sugg=
estions on how to run
Cantera in Windows XP machine as an user?

Thanks,

A=
lejandro
